item.title: Over hanging vegetation- requesting update, 5th December
item.description:
I am adding this as a new job as despite reporting on fix my street in August and Sept. Each time you did an internal referral and then closed. I raised with my local MP Louie French in November and Bexley council provided the below response. Please advise when this will be actioned. I have tried asking for an update on the job by the other constituents by putting my email in but you have not updated since 25/09 Thank you for your email regarding concerns raised by your constituent, (name redacted )of Ellenborough Road, Sidcup, DA14 5LA, in relation to overhanging foliage at the junction of Ellenborough Road and Palm Avenue. Firstly, please accept our apologies for the delay in actioning the reports submitted via FixMyStreet. We appreciate the frustration this has caused, particularly given the impact on pedestrians, including those with mobility and visual impairments. By way of clarification, the shrub bed in question has never historically been maintained by the London Borough of Bexley. It was previously assumed to fall under the ownership of L&Q Housing Association. However, L&Q have confirmed that they do not own this land and have never maintained it. In the meantime, and in recognition of the safety concerns, we have requested our grounds maintenance contractor to carry out works to clear the overhanging vegetation and remove the obstruction from the footway. This will ensure that the pathway can be safely navigated by all users. We will also continue to investigate and endeavour to identify the rightful owner of this land so that any subsequent maintenance responsibilities can be directed to the appropriate organisation. We trust this update provides reassurance to (name redacted) and other residents affected by this issue. Please feel free to share this response with your constituent”
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellenborough Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 on public footpat, 4th December
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 on public footpath between the north end of Lairdale Estate and footpath streetlight column ID number 77 you have recently installed dual car charging points. At the back of footpath are two cabinets – one black (telecom) and green cabinet which I assume relates to car charges as new ie Lambeth property. Remove graffiti please. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview link – NB link does not show car charger as the green cabinet as new: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Rosendale+Rd,+Norwood,+London/@51.4468004,-0.0996209,3a,15y,159.19h,88.36t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sfAA1FwNrrgmxoUdGbS24kA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D1.6362814732536748%26panoid%3DfAA1FwNrrgmxoUdGbS24kA%26yaw%3D159.19352489334256!7i16384!8i8192!4m6!3m5!1s0x487604063a15a687:0x5a39a8519c416f51!8m2!3d51.4408141!4d-0.0961998!16s%2Fg%2F1vm_xbvd?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTIwMi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22-23, Burrow Walk, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
